data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If they are always facing forward, then you would not go backward. Thus, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turning around does not recur anywhere. You could try saying take 4 steps and then turn around. So, the answer is no.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you followed instructions to take 4 steps, you take 4 steps. If you followed instructions to take 6 steps, you take 6 steps. Turning around takes 10 steps. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You must take 7 steps in order to return to the starting point. You may be able to take only one step. So, the answer is it is not possible to tell.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 10 steps. Turn left. Turn left. Take 9 steps. Take 3 steps. Take 3 steps. Turn around. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Doing this will always returns you back to the starting point. If you take 10, 9 steps, then your back to the begining point. So, the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn left. Turn right. Take 7 steps. Turn around. Take 7 steps. Turn right. Turn left. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn around is the same concept as taking 7 steps again to get back to the starting point. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn right. Turn right. Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
The number of steps in one instruction - the number of steps that turn right - does not depend on the number of steps and how long they are taken. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Turn around. Take 8 steps. Take 2 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
The whole cycle from start to finish doesn’t require any additional steps beyond the initial start. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step left. Take 4 steps forward. Take 6 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Turn your head and face forward to take 1 step left. Immediately, take 4 steps ahead to move 1 step to the right. Immediately, take 2 steps to the left to move 2 steps to the left. Immediately, take 2 steps to the right to move 2 steps to the right. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 3 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn around. Take 2 steps. Take 7 steps. Take 3 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
There are no 5 remaining steps, only 5 parts. If one takes 2 steps, one is not making enough progress to go back 5 parts. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 3 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you always face forward and take 1 step backward it is assumed that you will always take 3 steps forward. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 6 steps backward. Take 8 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 5 steps left. Take 2 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

When you go backward, you are always facing forward. If you turn around and look at anything you will always be facing forward. When you turn around and look at something you will always be facing your right, not the direction you are facing right now. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps left. Take 3 steps left. Take 1 step left. Take 3 steps backward. Take 6 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 4 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

In this set of instructions, it says the first instructions are taken in a straight forward manner. If you take a number of steps backwards, you cannot return to the starting point. If you return to the starting point in a straight forward manner, you must not take any steps backward. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 4 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 1 step right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You can always face forward if you always face forward. There are 4 steps left and 3 steps forward. One step right is opposite to taking 4 steps left and 3 steps forward. So, the answer is no.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 3 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 6 steps left. Take 1 step forward. Take 3 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
To return to the starting position, always face forward. Always face forward. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn right. Turn right. Turn around. Turn left. Take 4 steps. Take 10 steps. Take 8 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
To turn around, you would take 1 step right. So, it would take you 4 steps. Similarly, to take 8 steps, you would take 8, or at least 4 steps. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 10 steps. Turn around. Take 9 steps. Take 10 steps. Turn around. Take 3 steps. Take 6 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Take 6 steps and you are back at your starting place. Take 10 steps and you are back at your starting point. So, the answer is no.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn right when you turn around. Turn around and turn around. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn around. Take 1 step. Take 2 steps. Take 9 steps. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Take 7 steps and take 1 step to get back to the starting point. Since you start next to 5 steps away from the starting point, you take 9 steps total for this sequence. The starting point does not require this sequence and should be returned to the starting point. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn right. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn right and go to the right. If you turn right, you go back to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 1 step. Take 1 step. Take 3 steps. Turn left. Take 6 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

To take 6 steps, you take 6 steps, from the starting point. Now, to turn left, take 6 steps, from the starting point. If you were to take a step in the same direction as the starting point, then, the starting point would be the step that is taken 3 steps away then, you take that step away to proceed forward. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 5 steps. Take 3 steps. Take 2 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
It takes 10 steps to turn around. All the steps taken when you walk back to the beginning is..5 steps. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 3 steps. Take 7 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turnaround is another way to say return. 3 steps is the same as 7 steps. 10 steps is the same as 10 steps. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 7 steps left. Take 2 steps right. Take 5 steps backward. Take 8 steps left. Take 7 steps forward. Take 7 steps right. Take 9 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If we look at the left side of the line of instructions, we see 7 + 7 = 17. If we look at the right side of the line of instructions, we see 2 + 7 = 16. Take seven steps backward and take five steps forward to come back to where we started. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 7 steps backward. Take 9 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
When you face forward always, you still in the starting point. When you backwards face, seven steps are taken backwards. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

To turn around and take 4 steps, requires that you turn back around and take 4 steps. Turning back around returns the starting point of the direction in which you turned around. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 6 steps left. Take 6 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Just because you are facing forward, it does not mean you will go backward. On the opposite side is facing forward. Final answer: it is not possible to tell.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn right. Take 5 steps. Turn around. Take 5 steps. Turn around. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turning right will bring you to the beginning. Taking 5 steps will return you to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 2 steps backward. Take 3 steps backward. Take 3 steps backward. Take 8 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you continue to face forward, then two steps forward is still forward. If you take two steps backward, the arrow will be facing backward. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 3 steps. Take 10 steps. Take 4 steps. Take 1 step. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
When you have taken 4 steps, you return to the starting point. Your current state is taking 1 step. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 9 steps. Turn around. Take 9 steps. Turn around. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You can read this simple tidbit as: Take 9 steps. (Take 9 steps and go around one of the side of the building) to your starting point. So, the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 10 steps right. Take 7 steps backward. Take 3 steps left. Take 8 steps backward. Take 3 steps backward. Take 8 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
People don’t always face right in this video. People usually face backward after facing forward. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Turn around. Turn around. Turn around. Take 1 step. Take 6 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you are currently walking away from the starting point, you can return back to that starting point after taking 1 step. Turning around will set you back an extra 7 feet, so you can't just go back to the starting point after turning around. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 5 steps backward. Take 4 steps backward. Take 9 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
A person can only go a certain number of steps forward. One may return back to a starting point by taking steps forward. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 5 steps left. Take 1 step backward. Take 4 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 8 steps left. Take 6 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Steps taken right are the ones to the right of the starting point and must be taken 1 step back. Steps also taken left are those to the left of the starting point. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 3 steps forward. Take 3 steps backward. Take 3 steps backward. Take 7 steps left. Take 7 steps right. Take 8 steps backward. Take 4 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
The sentence is as follows: Face forward. Take 3 steps forward. Take 3 steps backward. Take 7 steps left. Take 7 steps right. Take 8 steps backward. Take 4 steps backward. So, the answer is no.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn around. Take 2 steps. Take 8 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Turn around. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

You can go back to the starting point in each of the three modalities. Just because the instructions say you take 8 steps does not mean you go back to the starting point in each. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 6 steps forward. Take 4 steps forward. Take 9 steps backward. Take 1 step backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
One must take 6 steps forward, and 4 steps backward. Nine measures the distance that you must go backward. The distance of one step forward and its place backward are equal. So, the answer is No.

You cannot face left and right. You cannot walk straight forward and back. You cannot walk straight forward and left and right. So, the answer is no.

Always face forward and always face forward. Doing the following sets of steps reverses the direction you were facing at all times. Doing the following sets of steps forwards reverses the direction you were facing at all times. So, the answer is no.

There are 10 steps in the direction you're going in. Take 10 steps to get 10 steps turned around. Return 20 feet out to the starting point. So, the answer is no.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 7 steps left. Take 8 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Take 4 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

The starting point should always be facing forward. The first 9 steps are taken to face forward. The first 5 steps are taken to face left. The first 3 steps are taken to face right. The last 3 steps are taken to face left. The starting point should always be facing forward. You cannot face toward your starting point if you face towards your starting point. So, the answer is No.

Take 9 steps forward. Take 5 steps right. Take 1 step forward. Take 3 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You always start backwards. Those are the three steps you must take to return back to the beginning. So, the answer is No.

Take 2 steps forward. Take 9 steps forward. Take 3 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you follow the directions, it is unlikely that you will return to the starting point. You walk backwards, always facing forward. So, the answer is no.

The left direction requires a 9 - step change to return to the starting point. The right direction requires a 3 - step change to return to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 6 steps right. Take 9 steps left. Take 5 steps left. Take 8 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

A person takes 9 steps left. If you follow the instructions to the right and left, you will take 5 steps left. If you follow the instructions to the right and left, you will take 6 steps right and 8 steps right. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 4 steps left. Take 5 steps backward. Take 2 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you always face forward, you take the first step that goes left. You take 4 steps left, take 5 steps backward, take 2 steps forward. So, the answer is no.

If you always face forward, you can take 10 steps forward. Take 8 steps backward can bring you to take 10 steps forward. Take 7 steps backward can bring you to take 7 steps right. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 7 steps backward. Take 10 steps right. Take 4 steps forward. Take 1 step left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
To go from right to left: 7 steps backwards. To go forward: 4 steps forwards. To go left: 10 steps right. Answer: Yes.
